content.raw:
These functions were deprecated in gazebo6 and are being removed for gazebo7. Users will see these warnings as long as they compile their code against gazebo6 before gazebo7.

Devil's advocate:

There are ROS indigo users still on gazebo2 or ROS jade users on gazebo5, and their code could break on gazebo7 if it used any of the removed functions. Also any code that wants to compile against gazebo5 and gazebo7 will require ifdef's.

These aren't necessarily deal-breakers; I'm just trying to think about the consequences. Perhaps we should be explicit about how many major releases will occur between deprecation and removal?
